intro: Hildegardia sundaica, commonly known as the Sunda hildegardia, is a flowering plant native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Meliaceae, which includes mahogany and other tropical hardwoods. The plant is characterized by its compound leaves and small, clustered flowers that are typically greenish-yellow in color. It thrives in humid, tropical environments and is often found in lowland rainforests. Due to its limited distribution and ecological significance, it is of interest to botanists and conservationists.
